parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Evil report, defamation, words of ill omen. From a compound of dus- and pheme; defamation.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
Now, just now, at this moment. Adverb from a derivative of airo through the idea of suspension; just now.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Refuse, offscouring, filth. From a compound of peri and kathairo; something cleaned off all around, i.e. Refuse.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
From a comparative of peri and psao; something brushed all around, i.e. Off-scrapings.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
